Posts.Content: WinningSoFar wrote: If it isn't one thing, it's another. I have postmenopausal spotting and have some kind of 'object' in my uterus. It was biopsied a week ago and of course, while not sitting on pins and needles, I'm getting cranky waiting for the results. Results were back yesterday but no response to me yet. Yikes. What are they waiting for. CALL ME. TELL ME. Did I mention I'm cranky? Surgery 6/30/1999 Lumpectomy: Right Dx 7/1999, ILC/IDC, Right, 2cm, Stage IIB, Grade 1, 0/4 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Radiation Therapy 7/29/1999 Whole-breast: Breast Surgery 6/30/2000 Prophylactic ovary removal Dx 9/26/2011, IBC, Right, 4cm, Stage IV, metastasized to bone, Grade 3, 0/5 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER2- Targeted Therapy 10/30/2011 Avastin (bevacizumab) Chemotherapy 11/3/2011 Abraxane (albumin-bound or nab-paclitaxel) Surgery 5/4/2012 Lymph node removal: Right, Sentinel, Underarm/Axillary; Mastectomy: Right Radiation Therapy 4/14/2013 External: Bone Chemotherapy 2/28/2014 Abraxane (albumin-bound or nab-paclitaxel) Surgery 12/10/2014 Reconstruction (left); Reconstruction (right) Dx 3/2019, ILC/IDC, Stage IV, metastasized to bone, Grade 2, ER+/PR+, HER2- (FISH) Targeted Therapy 3/14/2019 Verzenio Hormonal Therapy Femara (letrozole) Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Awaiting endometrial biopsy results WinningSoFar annieoakley

Posts.Content: WinningSoFar wrote: My scan on Monday shows that NED has gone away and T7 has lit up. 18 months NED over. Is that a long or short time for a chemo to work? Posts.Title: NED is gone WinningSoFar WinningSoFar

Posts.Content: WinningSoFar wrote: I was diagnosed with Stage IV IBC triple negative in 9/2011 with 5 spots on my bones.  With chemo and radiation and Xgeva, all those spots have resolved.  Thank God.  Now, my internal mammary chain is lighting up (SUV11) on my last pet/ct scan.  And another spot shows up in my infraspinatus muscle (SUV4).  Radiologist thinks both are probably mets from breast cancer.  The internal mammary chain had lit up before at a much lower SUV level and was biopsied.  I was assured it was benign.  Guess not! Has anyone else had these mets?  What was your experience? Posts.Content: WinningSoFar wrote: I've been fighting this cancer for eight years. Nothing seems to be working even though my oncologist thinks that Kadzyla MIGHT be working. Has anyone used another drug after Kadzyla? Could you give me your reactions and recommendations   I find this website difficult and haven't filled out my profile yet. I'm exhausted by taking care of two fungating tumors. I'm very discouraged. Thank you in advance if you can help me.  Janet Surgery 6/30/1999 Lumpectomy: Right Dx 7/1999, ILC/IDC, Right, 2cm, Stage IIB, Grade 1, 0/4 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Radiation Therapy 7/29/1999 Whole-breast: Breast Surgery 6/30/2000 Prophylactic ovary removal Dx 9/26/2011, IBC, Right, 4cm, Stage IV, metastasized to bone, Grade 3, 0/5 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER2- Targeted Therapy 10/30/2011 Avastin (bevacizumab) Chemotherapy 11/3/2011 Abraxane (albumin-bound or nab-paclitaxel) Surgery 5/4/2012 Lymph node removal: Right, Sentinel, Underarm/Axillary; Mastectomy: Right Radiation Therapy 4/14/2013 External: Bone Chemotherapy 2/28/2014 Abraxane (albumin-bound or nab-paclitaxel) Surgery 12/10/2014 Reconstruction (left); Reconstruction (right) Dx 3/2019, ILC/IDC, Stage IV, metastasized to bone, Grade 2, ER+/PR+, HER2- (FISH) Targeted Therapy 3/14/2019 Verzenio Hormonal Therapy Femara (letrozole) Log in to post a reply
